result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor R. Diedrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:18 pm case called. Defendant Trevor R. Diedrick in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Johnson. Statement by Defendant. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1-SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. CONDITIONS: 60 days WCJ, with Huber. No Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served. To begin service no later than July 15, 2017. AODA and follow through, Absolute sobriety, no bars, no impairing substances without a valid prescription. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample and surcharge. DNA may be expunged through petition to DOJ. COUNT 2-SWD and places on probation for 2 years. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through, Absolute sobriety, no bars, no impairing substances without a valid prescription. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample and surcharge. DNA may be expunged through petition to DOJ.  Appeal Rights Given.
LETC from DA Blader to Court and Atty Johnson, Dated 4/25/2017 - Absent a specific action being requested or a motion filed, the Court will not issue a formal response to this communication.
Witness Fee Certificates - $64.00 Total

Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Sentencing hearing on May 25, 2017 at 02:15 pm.

Day 2 of JT - Case Called @ 8:05 AM: Defendant Trevor R. Diedrick in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA has reviewed Jury Instruction - has a concern as to JI 115 and language that should be stricken.  Atty Johnson agrees with the State.  Court will amend the INFO to delete the reference contained therein sua sponte.  Per Atty Johnson requests some standard language also be included regarding the verdict and would object to the proposed JI.  Court does not want an inconsistent verdict and will request Jury answer both questions.  Court will issue the instruction as composed and implied effects for the Jury.  Emphasizes for the jury the sequence to be followed.  Brief instruction conference will follow prior to the case going to the Jury.  Defendant will testify today.  Court addresses colloquy with Defendant.  Accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of self incrimination and will allow 6th Amendment right to testify.  DA states it was the intention that all Exhibits marked yesterday were properly entered and received into evidence.  Atty Johnson agrees that all exhibits should be properly received.  Court confirms same.  Court greets Jury and addresses the jury as to the admonishment given at the close of the day yesterday.  DA rests case in chief subject to rebuttal.  Duane Detjens sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by Atty Johnson.   Ex 30 marked.  State objects.  Ex 30 entered, received and published.  Cross Exam by DA Blader.  Jason Pennau sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by Atty Johnson.  Cross Exam by DA Blader.  Re Direct by Atty Johnson. Sarah Miner sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by Atty Johnson.  Cross Exam by DA Blader.  Ex 2 republished.  Jury Excused for Argument of counsel.  Jury returns.  Cross Exam by DA Blader returns.  Trevor Diedrick sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by Atty Johnson.  Cross Exam by DA Blader.  Re-Direct by Atty Johnson.  Re Cross by DA Blader.  Defense rests.  Evidence Phase of JT now completed.  State will not call any Rebuttal witnesses.  Evidence is now closed.  Court has revised JI 115 for counsel's consideration - lesser included now revised and provided for counsel.  Recess @ 9:55 AM.  Case Recalled @ 10:15 AM.  Counsel agree with verdict forms.  Jury Instructions finalized.  Jury Re-enters and Court gives Jury Instructions.  Closing argument by DA Blader.  Closing argument by Atty Johnson.  Final Closing by DA Blader.  Final Jury Instructions given.  Extra Juror culled by lot for 12 person panel.  Bailiffs sworn.  Jury panel excused for deliberations.  Off Record at 11:50 AM:  Reconvene @ 1:27 PM: Jury Question.  2 questions recited.  Court will reserve any 520 instruction and sees that instruction as premature.  Counsel agree to the response as to evidence entered.  Written response given to counsel.  Counsel discuss evidence and procedure for jury viewing.  Court directs that evidence from Ex Nos 24 and 25 as requested by the jury be delivered by court security to jury room for viewing.  Concerns of counsel noted by the Court.  Off Record at 1:40 PM  Back of Record @ 1:57 PM Further statement rec'd from Bailiff - Court will further instruct the Jury.  Jury brought back in.  Supplemental instruction given to the Jury by the Court.  Off Record at 2:00 PM  Back of Record @ 2:40 PM:  Request from Jury to listen to audio portions of evidence.  Options offered to Counsel.  Jury returns to the Courtroom.  Jury exits the courtroom for counsel to set up their audio.  Counsel state for the record the number of clips to be played.  Court Adj at 2:52 PM.  15 mins for technology set up.  Back of Record @ 3:15 PM:  Counsel agree that the entire audio CD has been entered into evidence.  Jury joins the courtroom.   DA Blader commences replay of 6 clips from Ex 18. Atty Johnson commences repay of 6 clips from Ex 19.  Off Record @ 3:50 PM:  Back of Record @ 4:20 PM:  Court advises counsel of latest Jury statement.  Counsel agree with the Court's proposal to advise the jury.  Jury again joins the courtroom.  Foreperson makes statement to the Court.  Foreperson agrees that the jury needs to return and discuss JI 115 in further detail as a group.  Jury again excused.  Off Record @ 4:28 PM:  Back of Record @ 4:55 PM:  Jury joins courtroom and Foreperson confirms jury has reached a verdict.  Jury excused for Court to address counsel as to inconsistent verdict received.  Counsel agree that verdict as presented is inconsistent.  Jury again joins the courtroom.  Court advises the Jury as to Verdict form and highlights instructions on page 2 of the Verdict form for the Court to receive a legal verdict.  Jury instructed to return to deliberation room to complete a new verdict form.  Jury excused at 5:09 PM:  Back of Record @ 5:17 PM:  Jury again joins the courtroom.  Court has received Verdict Form and recites same.  Ct 1: NG of Poss w/Int.  Lesser included offense POT - Guilty.  Ct 2 Guilty of POP.  Court commences polling of the jury for affirmations from each juror.   Jury again excused for Court to address inconsistent affirmation received. Jury again joins the courtroom at 5:27 PM:  Court addresses Foreperson as to the unanimous verdict reached.  Foreperson confirms unanimous verdict as to Ct 1 of NG.  Court continues with polling of the jury for affirmations. Juror makes statement during affirmation.  Court recommences Jury polling for required affirmations.  Counsel are satisfied with the Court's polling of the jury.  The Court:  Finds hung jury as to Ct 1 of INFO.  Lesser included charge of POT and Ct 2 POP - finding unanimity is reached as to both of those offenses of guilty and JOC entered of guilty.  No verdict was reached as to  Poss w/Int to Del.  Court leaves at the State's discretion disposition of the pending charge.  SEH Scheduled and Def is reminded that bond continues pending  SEH hearing.  Court adjourns at 5:45 PM.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2017 at 02:15 pm.
Exhibit Nos. 1 thru 29 from Day 1 of Jury trial

Case called for PT discussions @ 8:07 AM: Defendant Trevor R. Diedrick in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has reviewed State's Second MIL filed 4/19/2017.  State requests ruling on 2nd MIL regarding Def's treatment records.  DA believes records have no bearing on defense.  Argument by Atty Johnson - believes records are relevant and leaves to the Court's discretion.   Evidentiary value of post event treatment records extinguished, absent some degree of symmetry between charged event and 1st UA taken to provide some type of quantification - records are not relevant to the issue being tried and further determines that any commentary provided to provider would have a self serving nature to it - inadmissible hearsay.  Admission declined of post event treatment records.  As to squad video - some pausing will be required due to technology requirements.  Court orders that any audio to be marked and admitted to alleviate stenographer's record being taken.  DA makes the Court aware of muted issues and defense issues.  Atty Johnson has provided the Court with a transcript - proprietary software an issue and come portions cannot be heard.  Transcript may serve no purpose for trial today.  Court believes jury should draw their own conclusions based upon what is being heard.  Transcript would provide an interpretive commentary - evidentiary value to be assigned by the jury.  Atty Johnson argues as to 2nd hand smoke exposure to the children.  DA was not anticipated to bring in during case in chief.  State reserves the right.   Court sees absolutely relevant and State can bring in during case in chief and is entitled to bring in relevant information - permitted if State wishes to introduce.  Counsel agree as to para charge and specific item will be identified.  Court orders oral amendment of INFO to reflect specific item.  Atty Johnson continues his objection as to 907.02 absent a Daubert hrg.  Court takes notice of continuing objection.  Video use - separate medium - separate exhibit to be marked due to technology issues of video use.  Voir Dire started 8:30 a.m.  Entire panel sworn in.  Questioned by the court and attorneys.  Voir Dire Completed at 9:40.  Impaneled jury sworn in.  Recess until 10:00 a.m.  Court's opening statements to the Jury.  Opening statement by DA Blader.  Opening statement by Atty Johnson.  Officer Scott Schaut sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA.  Ex No 1 marked.  Ex 1 entered, received and published. No Cross Exam.  Brief Recess  Back of Record @ 10:50 AM.  Dep Scott Eagan sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA.   Ex No 3 marked. Ex 3 entered, received and published. Ex No 4 marked. Ex No 4 entered, received and published.  Ex No 5 marked. Ex 5 entered, received and published. Ex No 6 marked.  Ex 6 entered, received and published. Ex 7 marked.  Ex 7 entered, received and published. Ex 8 marked.  Ex 8 entered, received and published.  Ex 9 marked.  Ex 9 entered, received and published. Ex 10 marked. Ex 10 entered, received and published. Ex 11 marked. Ex 11 entered, received and published.  Ex 12 marked.  Ex 12 entered, received and published.  Ex 13 marked. Ex 13 entered, received and published. Ex 14 marked. Ex 14 entered, received and published. Ex 15 marked.  Ex 15 entered, received and published. Ex 16 marked.  Ex 16 entered, received and published. Ex 17 marked.  Ex 17 entered, received and published. Ex 18 marked - CD Rom Audio Recording - State's Version.  Ex 18 received and published.  7 Separate Clips played for the jury. Lunch Break at Noon. Back of Record at 1:00 PM.  Ex 19 CD Rom Audio Recording - Def's Version (Windows Media).  Statement by DA as to clarity issues of CD's - same video may confuse the jury.   Jury to be provided clarification as to both Ex 18 and 19 - no issue to be raised as to the authenticity of one or the other.  With that clarification Court will permit the use of the 2nd video.  Cross Exam by Atty Johnson of Dep Scott Eagan.  Ex 22 marked.  Ex 22 entered, received and published.  Ex 21 marked.  Ex 21 entered, received and published. Re Direct by DA Blader.  Re Cross Exam by Atty Johnson.  Re Direct by DA Blader.  Re Cross Exam by Atty Johnson.  Sgt Brian Wenzel sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA Blader.  Record to reflect positive ID of Def by Witness. Ex 2 marked.  Ex 2 entered, received and published.  Ex 23 marked.  Ex 23 entered, received and published.  Off Record for Break.  Back of Record @ 3:00 PM.  Sgt Wenzel testimony continues.  Cross Exam by Atty Johnson.  Re Direct by DA Blader.  Det Nate Klapoetke sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA Blader.  Ex 24 marked - Lg Evidence Bag.  Ex 24 admission held in abeyance pending foundation. Ex 24 entered, received and to be published.  Ex 25 marked - Clear Plastic Sealed Evidence Bags.  Court will permit invasion of Ex 25 to permit inspection of various items and explanation to the jury. Ex 26 marked.  Ex 26 entered, received and published.  Ex 27 marked.  Ex 27 entered, received and published.  Ex 28 marked.  Ex 28 entered, received and published. Ex 29 marked.  Ex 29 entered, received and published. Cross Exam by Atty Johnson.  Re Direct by DA Blader.  DCI Agent Steven Lewis sworn in for testimony. Direct Exam by DA Blader.  Cross Exam by Atty Johnson.  Re Direct by DA Blader.  Re Cross by Atty Johnson.  Re Direct by DA Blader.  Re Cross by Atty Johnson.  Court recesses for the evening and so addresses the jurors.  Off Record @ 4:45 PM

from DA Blader to Atty Johnson - Re: Background of the State's witness Agent Lewis

Case called @ 1:34 p.m. Defendant Trevor R. Diedrick in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Proposed MIL filed by Atty Johnson include a 907.02 "Daubert" motion regarding the testimony to be given by Agent Lewis.  Argument by DA Blader regarding 907.02 motion. Argument by Atty Johnson regarding 907.02 motion. The Court will allow Agent Lewis to testify at trial. The Court will not however permit multiple 907.02 witnesses to testify. Atty Johnson also requesting in MIL to have anyone referring to the defendant at the trial refer to him by name. The Court will always refer to the DE by name but will not order that any other parties must refer to the DE by name. The Court grants the request for a sequestration order to commence immediately following voir dire. The Court also grants Atty Johnson's motion in paragraph 10 of the MIL and denies Atty Johnson's motion in paragraph 11 of the MIL. Statement by DA Blader regarding paragraph 10 of the MIL - requesting clarification of order. The Court does clarify how the witness will testify regarding the issue.  The Court advises how the verdict forms will be prepared - flowing verdict form to address the lesser included offense. The Court questions counsel about a possible multiplicity issue with Count two.  The Court addresses 906.09 motions regarding defense witnesses.  The Court grants the balance of the State's MIL not already addressed. 40 jurors to be summoned. Plea rejection letter to be filed and kept under seal in the Court's file.

2:17 pm case called. Defendant Trevor R. Diedrick in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter to proceed to preliminary hearing. DA Blader calls Deputy Scott M. Eagan, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibits #1, #2, #3, #4, #5, #6, & #7 offered and received. Cross exam by Attorney Johnson. Re-direct by DA Blader. Re-cross by Attorney Johnson. Witness excused. DA Blader calls, Det. Sgt. Nate Klapoetke, witness sworn, testimony given. Re-direct by Attorney Johnson. Court finds probable cause has been established and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Court questions parties regarding scheduling. Attorney Johnson requests different date for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:00 PM: Defendant Trevor R. Diedrick in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.  DA argues for $5000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection by Atty Johnson.  The Court:  Orders $5000 Signature Bond as requested.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 10:35 am.
